document.content:
# Data Integration

## Stability

  * Overall stability, correctness
  * Foundational architecture
  
## Harmonization

  * Declarative harmonization
    - Prepare
    - Collect
    - Map
    - Match
    - Merge
    - Persist
  * Smart Mastering
  * Source model discovery
    - Source profiling
    - Source Explorer UI

## Egress

### API First Endpoints

  * Java
  * Delegated auth*
  * Secure by default
  * Workload isolation and instrumentation
  * Push, alerting
  * Debugging
  * Unit and integration testing (“Refactor with confidence”)
  * Management UI
  * .NET, Node.js, Python
  * Entity CRUD

### Self-Service Export

  * Declarative mapping
  * Redaction
  * Cloud: S3
  * Provenance tracking
  * Declarative mapping, UI
  * Entity Explorer UI
  
### Change Data Capture

  * Pull: Temporal queries
  * Push: Triggers

## Policy

  * Confidentiality: Permissions, redaction
  * Validity/Fitness for Purpose: Assertions run at lifecycle events (e.g. land in source, before harmonization, after map, on final, etc.)
  * Reproducibility: PROV by default and via API
  * Chain of Custody: Confidentiality + Reproducibility
  * Integrate with external metadata catalogs (e.g. IBM at NT, Informatica at ABN)
  * Lifecycle management: Tiered storage, archive/purge

## Operation

  * Multi-user: git-based pull-commit-push workflow
  * Dev-Test-Prod workflow
  * Headless API operations
  
## Ingest

  * Bulk relational
  * Cloud: S3
  * Straight-through processing
